{{Infobox musical artist | name = Mattie Delaney | image = | caption = | image_size = | background = solo_singer | birth_name = Mattie Doyle | alias = | birth_date = ca. 1905
south of [[Tchula, Mississippi]], United States | death_date = Unknown | instrument = [[Human voice|Vocals]], [[guitar]] | genre = [[Delta blues]] | occupation = [[Singing|Singer]], [[guitarist]], [[songwriter]] | years_active = Early 1930s | label = [[Vocalion Records|Vocalion]] | associated_acts = | website = | notable_instruments = }} '''Mattie Delaney''' (ca. 1905 – unknown) was an [[United States|American]] [[delta blues]] [[singing|singer]] and [[guitarist]]. She was active in the 1930s with only two known [[sound recording and reproduction|recordings]]: "Down the Big Road Blues," and "Tallahatchie River Blues." ==Career== Mattie Delaney was probably born '''Mattie Doyle''' south of [[Tchula, Mississippi]]. Around 1927 she may have moved to [[Memphis, Tennessee]]. Contemporary witnesses remember seeing her perform at [[Swan Lake, Mississippi]].{{cite web|url=http://musicman.mtsu.edu/broadsides/Wardlow/pdfs/cpm_94048_tta182o_010101_pres_HenryAustin.pdf |title=Center for Popular Music, Interview by Gayle Dean Wardlow with Henry Austin and Lilly Berry|format=PDF|publisher=Musicman.mtsu.edu|accessdate=2014-01-27}} She recorded two songs for the [[Vocalion Records]] [[record label|label]] in February 1930.[http://www.nme.com/video/id/2XCitx3BcoE/search/mattie-delaney ]{{dead link|date=January 2014}} Her song "Down The Big Road Blues" was a variant of [[Tommy Johnson (blues musician)|Tommy Johnson]]'s "Big Road Blues".{{cite web|author= |url=http://sundayblues.org/archives/77 |title=Big Road Blues Show 12/2/07: Forgotten Blues Ladies: I Ain't Your Hen Mister Fly Rooster | Big Road Blues |publisher=Sundayblues.org |date=2007-12-02 |accessdate=2014-01-27}} One [[music journalism|music journalist]] noted "Delaney issuing a matter-of-fact report in "Tallahatchie River Blues".{{cite book | first= Tony | last= Russell | year= 1997 | title= The Blues: From Robert Johnson to Robert Cray | edition= | publisher= [[Carlton Publishing Group|Carlton Books Limited]] | location= [[Dubai]] | page= 211 | isbn= 1-85868-255-X}} She was unusual for a female performer of the time, in that she played guitar accompaniment and sang [[topical song]]s. Nothing is known of her life after the recordings.{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.goldminemag.com/tag/mattie-delaney |title=Mattie Delaney - Goldmine Magazine |publisher=Goldminemag.com |date=2010-10-12 |accessdate=2014-01-27}} Two of Delaney's songs were featured on the ''Mississippi Girls (1928-1931)'' [[compilation album]], issued in September 1991.{{cite web|author=Larry Hoffman |url=http://www.allmusic.com/album/mississippi-girls-1928-1931-mw0000678332 |title=Mississippi Girls (1928-1931) - Various Artists | Songs, Reviews, Credits, Awards |publisher=AllMusic |date=1928-02-03 |accessdate=2014-01-27}} ==Cover versions== Several [[cover version]]s of Delaney's songs have been recorded over the years. These include: *"Travelin' Blues" - [[Rory Block]] (''[[High Heeled Blues]]'') (1981){{cite web|author=Ron Wynn |url=http://www.allmusic.com/album/high-heeled-blues-mw0000200657 |title=High Heeled Blues - Rory Block | Songs, Reviews, Credits, Awards |publisher=AllMusic |date= |accessdate=2014-01-27}} *"Tallahatchie River Blues" - Rory Block (''When a Woman Gets the Blues'') (1995){{cite web|author= |url=http://www.allmusic.com/album/when-a-woman-gets-the-blues-mw0000172183 |title=When a Woman Gets the Blues - Rory Block | Songs, Reviews, Credits, Awards |publisher=AllMusic |date= |accessdate=2014-01-27}} *"Down the Big Road Blues" - [[Lucinda Williams]] (''[[Car Wheels on a Gravel Road]]'') (1998){{cite web|author= |url=http://www.allmusic.com/artist/mattie-delaney-mn0000391118/songs |title=Mattie Delaney | Songs |publisher=AllMusic |date= |accessdate=2014-01-27}} ==See also== *[[List of blues musicians]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *{{Worldcat id|lccn-no98-28637}} * [http://www.wirz.de/music/delaney.htm Illustrated Mattie Delaney discography] {{Authority control|VIAF=9458076}} {{Persondata | NAME = Delaney, Mattie | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = Doyle, Mattie | SHORT DESCRIPTION = [[United States|American]] [[delta blues]] singer and guitarist | DATE OF BIRTH = 1905 | PLACE OF BIRTH = Tchula, [[Mississippi]], United States | DATE OF DEATH = unknown | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Delaney, Mattie}} [[Category:1905 births]] [[Category:Year of death missing]] [[Category:American blues guitarists]] [[Category:American blues musicians]] [[Category:American blues singers]] [[Category:American female guitarists]] [[Category:American female singers]] [[Category:Songwriters from Mississippi]] [[Category:Delta blues musicians]] [[Category:Year of birth uncertain]]
